content: jack o lantern cat sweater sizes small medium large corresponding to a cat body circumference of 9-11 12-14 15-17 the test knit for this was knit in a size medium for a cat with a semi-fluffy circumference of 14 see end for notes on cat measuring tips materials main color yarn - 60 70 80 grams worsted weight wool 140 160 180 yd 130 150 165 m contrasting color yarn - 2 grams worsted weight wool 5 yd 5 m 4mm us size 6 circular needle or dnp for ribbing 4 5mm us size 7 circular needle or dpn for body of sweater gauge 20 sts x 28 rnds is 4 in 10 cm with larger needles in stockinette st techniques used casting on and backwards loop cast on casting off knit 1 purl 1 ribbing knitting in the round duplicate stitching/embroidery pattern neckband sample is knit with patons classic cast on 65 78 91 stitches and join for knitting in the round being careful not wool worsted in main color to twist stitches pumpkin and contrasting color black knit 1 purl 1 rib until piece measures 1 from co edge or desired neckband length is reached for sizes small and larger the last st of the round will be a knit st body work the following two round pattern for 2 5 round 1 *k1 p3 k9* repeat from * to * for the rest of the round round 2 *p1 k1 p1 k1 k9* repeat from * to * for the rest of the round end after round 2 before moving on to the armhole shaping armholes round 1 k1 p3 k4 then cast off 8 stitches then p1 k7 then cast off 8 stitches k7 sts continue with *k1 p3 k9* repeat from * to * for the rest of the round round 2 p1 k1 p1 k1 k4 then cast on 8 stitches using the backwards loop cast on then k8 and cast on 8 stitches using the backwards loop cast on k7 sts continue with *p1 k1 p1 k1 k9* repeat from * to * for the rest of the round body continued continue with the two round pattern for another 5 round 1 *k1 p3 k9* repeat from * to * for the rest of the round round 2 *p1 k1 p1 k1 k9* repeat from * to * for the rest of the round your piece should now measure 8 5 from co edge if a longer sweater is desired continue with the two rnds of the body sweater pattern otherwise move on to the bottom ribbing bottom ribbing switch to knit 1 purl 1 rib and continue to knit in this ribbing stitch for 1 5 cast off in pattern weave in ends wet block if desired jack o lantern styling get creative use the contrasting yarn to design a face to put on the sweater to be seen on your cat s back
